plan: {"pro_tip": "Focus on simplicity; a functional MVP is better than a feature-rich but complex app.", "stack_reasoning": "This no-code stack leverages readily available tools. Google Sheets is free and allows for data tracking, while Google Forms provides a simple interface. Google App Script will automate the data transfer between Form submissions and the Sheet. It is like using basic Lego bricks to build something functional!", "tools_list": ["Google Sheets", "Google Forms", "Google App Script"], "build_steps": ["Create a Google Form with fields for date, time, and amount of water consumed.", "Create a Google Sheet to store the form submission data.", "Use Google App Script to automatically transfer data from Google Forms to Google Sheets each time a form is submitted.", "Use Google Sheet's built-in charting tools to visualize your daily water intake."], "copy_paste_prompt": "Write a google app script that automatically saves the form submission from a Google Form to a specific Google Sheet. The Google Sheet id is [insert sheet id here], and the form is set to write to the sheet after submit. I need to get the sheet, get the form and copy the data over after it is submitted.", "detected_tools": []}
